intro: Anisomeris purpusii, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its rapid growth and climbing habit. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It thrives in warm, sunny environments and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens but can become invasive if not managed properly.
